meanings.definition: Regard something as being caused by someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She attributed the loud noise to the thunderstorm outside.
meanings.sent2: The detective attributed the crime to the suspect's fingerprints at the scene.
meanings.sent3: The cat attributed the broken vase to the mischievous puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her success can be attributed to her hard work and determination.
meanings.sent5: The teacher attributed the students' improvement to their consistent practice.

meanings.definition: Ascribe a work or remark to a particular author, artist, or speaker.
meanings.sent1: The famous painting was attributed to the renowned artist.
meanings.sent2: The quote was wrongly attributed to the wrong historical figure.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly attributed the delicious dish to his magic cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project can be attributed to the teamwork of the entire group.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious poem was attributed to an anonymous writer.
